meanings.definition: A person who is lazy or idle.
meanings.sent1: The sluggard slept all day instead of helping with chores.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a sluggard and procrastinate on your responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: The sluggard's idea of exercise is lifting the TV remote.
meanings.sent4: His ambition was buried under the weight of his sluggard nature.
meanings.sent5: The sluggard's laziness was as heavy as a sack of rocks.

meanings.definition: To be slow or lazy in movement or action.
meanings.sent1: I sluggard through my morning routine when I'm tired.
meanings.sent2: Don't sluggard around, we have work to do!
meanings.sent3: The snail sluggarded its way across the garden path.
meanings.sent4: Time sluggards on when you're waiting for something exciting.
meanings.sent5: The old car sluggarded up the steep hill, struggling with each turn of the wheel.
